title: Magmas
content: According to Wikipedia ("Magma (algebra)", 08-Jan-2020, ~ https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/magma_(algebra) ) "In abstract algebra, a _magma_ [[...] is a basic kind of algebraic structure. Specifically, a magma consists of a set equipped with a single binary operation. The binary operation must be closed by definition but no other properties are imposed.". Since the concept of a "binary operation" is used in different variants, these differences are explained in more detail in the following: With ~ df-mpo , binary operations are defined by a rule, and with ~ df-ov , the value of a binary operation applied to two operands can be expressed. In both cases, the two operands can belong to different sets, and the result can be an element of a third set. However, according to Wikipedia "Binary operation", see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Binary_operation (19-Jan-2020), "... a binary operation on a set ` S ` is a mapping of the elements of the Cartesian product ` S X. S ` to S: ` f : S X. S --> S `. Because the result of performing the operation on a pair of elements of S is again an element of S, the operation is called a _closed_ binary operation on S (or sometimes expressed as having the property of closure).". To distinguish this more restrictive definition (in Wikipedia and most of the literature) from the general case, binary operations mapping the elements of the Cartesian product ` S X. S ` are more precisely called _internal binary operations_. If, in addition, the result is also contained in the set ` S `, the operation should be called _closed internal binary operation_. Therefore, a "binary operation on a set ` S `" according to Wikipedia is a "closed internal binary operation" in a more precise terminology. If the sets are different, the operation is explicitly called _external binary operation_ (see Wikipedia https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Binary_operation#External_binary_operations ). The definition of magmas (` Mgm `, see ~ df-mgm ) concentrates on the closure property of the associated operation, and poses no additional restrictions on it. In this way, it is most general and flexible.

df-plusf
blocks.content: Define group addition function. Usually we will use ` +g ` directly instead of ` +f ` , and they have the same behavior in most cases. The main advantage of ` +f ` for any magma is that it is a guaranteed function ( ~ mgmplusf ), while ` +g ` only has closure ( ~ mgmcl ). (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 14-Aug-2015.)

blocks.name: df-mgm
blocks.content: A _magma_ is a set equipped with an everywhere defined internal operation. Definition 1 in [BourbakiAlg1] p. 1, or definition of a groupoid in section I.1 of [Bruck] p. 1. Note: The term "groupoid" is now widely used to refer to other objects: (small) categories all of whose morphisms are invertible, or groups with a partial function replacing the binary operation. Therefore, we will only use the term "magma" for the present notion in set.mm. (Contributed by FL, 2-Nov-2009.) (Revised by AV, 6-Jan-2020.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-mgm(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4) {
  |- wceq(cmgm, cab(s0, wsbc(s1, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), wsbc(s2, cfv(cplusg, cv(s0)), wral(s3, cv(s1), wral(s4, cv(s1), wcel(co(cv(s3), cv(s2), cv(s4)), cv(s1))))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s4)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s4)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s2, s4)
  -| diffss(s3, s4)
}
blocks.pretty:
axiom df-mgm(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4) {
  ‚ä¢ Mgm = { s0 |[(Base ` s0)/ s1][(+ ` s0)/ s2]‚àÄ(s3 ‚àà s1, ‚àÄ(s4 ‚àà s1,(s3[s2]s4)‚àà s1))}
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s3, s4)
}

blocks.name: ismgm
blocks.content: The predicate "is a magma". (Contributed by FL, 2-Nov-2009.) (Revised by AV, 6-Jan-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm ismgm(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wb(wcel(c0, cmgm), wral(s0, c2, wral(s1, c2, wcel(co(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1)), c2)))))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cbs, c0))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cplusg, c0))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
} = {
  elab2g(hs2, c0, c1, cmgm, wral(s0, c2, wral(s1, c2, wcel(co(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1)), c2))), wsbc(hs1, cfv(cbs, cv(hs2)), wsbc(hs0, cfv(cplusg, cv(hs2)), wral(s0, cv(hs1), wral(s1, cv(hs1), wcel(co(cv(s0), cv(hs0), cv(s1)), cv(hs1)))))))
  sbcied2(hs1, cfv(cbs, cv(hs2)), universe, c2, wceq(cv(hs2), c0), wsbc(hs0, cfv(cplusg, cv(hs2)), wral(s0, cv(hs1), wral(s1, cv(hs1), wcel(co(cv(s0), cv(hs0), cv(s1)), cv(hs1))))), wral(s0, c2, wral(s1, c2, wcel(co(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1)), c2))))
  fvexd(cbs, cv(hs2), wceq(cv(hs2), c0))
  syl6eqr(cfv(cbs, cv(hs2)), c2, cfv(cbs, c0), wceq(cv(hs2), c0))
  fveq2(cv(hs2), c0, cbs)
  sbcied2(hs0, cfv(cplusg, cv(hs2)), universe, c3, wa(wceq(cv(hs2), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c2)), wral(s0, cv(hs1), wral(s1, cv(hs1), wcel(co(cv(s0), cv(hs0), cv(s1)), cv(hs1)))), wral(s0, c2, wral(s1, c2, wcel(co(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1)), c2))))
  fvexd(cplusg, cv(hs2), wa(wceq(cv(hs2), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c2)))
  syl6eqr(cfv(cplusg, cv(hs2)), c3, cfv(cplusg, c0), wa(wceq(cv(hs2), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c2)))
  adantr(wceq(cv(hs2), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c2), wceq(cfv(cplusg, cv(hs2)), cfv(cplusg, c0)))
  fveq2(cv(hs2), c0, cplusg)
  raleqbidv(s0, cv(hs1), c2, wa(wa(wceq(cv(hs2), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c2)), wceq(cv(hs0), c3)), wral(s1, cv(hs1), wcel(co(cv(s0), cv(hs0), cv(s1)), cv(hs1))), wral(s1, c2, wcel(co(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1)), c2)))
  raleqbidv(s1, cv(hs1), c2, wa(wa(wceq(cv(hs2), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c2)), wceq(cv(hs0), c3)), wcel(co(cv(s0), cv(hs0), cv(s1)), cv(hs1)), wcel(co(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1)), c2))
  eleq12d(co(cv(s0), cv(hs0), cv(s1)), cv(hs1), co(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1)), c2, wa(wa(wceq(cv(hs2), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c2)), wceq(cv(hs0), c3)))
  adantl(wa(wceq(cv(hs2), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c2)), wceq(cv(hs0), c3), wceq(co(cv(s0), cv(hs0), cv(s1)), co(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1))))
  oveq(cv(hs0), c3, cv(s0), cv(s1))
  simplr(wceq(cv(hs2), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c2), wceq(cv(hs0), c3))
  df-mgm(hs2, hs1, hs0, s0, s1)
  diff.hs2.c(c0)
  diff.hs2.w(wral(s0, c2, wral(s1, c2, wcel(co(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1)), c2))))

  diff.hs1.s(s0)
  diff.hs1.s(s1)
  diff.hs2.s(hs0)
  diff.hs2.s(s0)
  diff.hs2.s(s1)

blocks.pretty:
thm ismgm(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  ‚ä¢ (c0 ‚àà c1 ‚Üí(c0 ‚àà Mgm ‚Üî ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c2, ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà c2,(s0[c3]s1)‚àà c2))))
  ‚ä£ c2 =(Base ` c0)
  ‚ä£ c3 =(+ ` c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c3)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c3)
} = {
  elab2g(hs2, c0, c1, cmgm, ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c2, ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà c2,(s0[c3]s1)‚àà c2)), [(Base ` hs2)/ hs1][(+ ` hs2)/ hs0]‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà hs1, ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà hs1,(s0[hs0]s1)‚àà hs1)))
  sbcied2(hs1, (Base ` hs2), universe, c2, hs2 = c0, [(+ ` hs2)/ hs0]‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà hs1, ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà hs1,(s0[hs0]s1)‚àà hs1)), ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c2, ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà c2,(s0[c3]s1)‚àà c2)))
  fvexd(cbs, hs2, hs2 = c0)
  syl6eqr((Base ` hs2), c2, (Base ` c0), hs2 = c0)
  fveq2(hs2, c0, cbs)
  sbcied2(hs0, (+ ` hs2), universe, c3, (hs2 = c0 ‚àß hs1 = c2), ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà hs1, ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà hs1,(s0[hs0]s1)‚àà hs1)), ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c2, ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà c2,(s0[c3]s1)‚àà c2)))
  fvexd(cplusg, hs2, (hs2 = c0 ‚àß hs1 = c2))
  syl6eqr((+ ` hs2), c3, (+ ` c0), (hs2 = c0 ‚àß hs1 = c2))
  adantr(hs2 = c0, hs1 = c2, (+ ` hs2)=(+ ` c0))
  fveq2(hs2, c0, cplusg)
  raleqbidv(s0, hs1, c2, ((hs2 = c0 ‚àß hs1 = c2)‚àß hs0 = c3), ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà hs1,(s0[hs0]s1)‚àà hs1), ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà c2,(s0[c3]s1)‚àà c2))
  raleqbidv(s1, hs1, c2, ((hs2 = c0 ‚àß hs1 = c2)‚àß hs0 = c3), (s0[hs0]s1)‚àà hs1, (s0[c3]s1)‚àà c2)
  eleq12d((s0[hs0]s1), hs1, (s0[c3]s1), c2, ((hs2 = c0 ‚àß hs1 = c2)‚àß hs0 = c3))
  adantl((hs2 = c0 ‚àß hs1 = c2), hs0 = c3, (s0[hs0]s1)=(s0[c3]s1))
  oveq(hs0, c3, s0, s1)
  simplr(hs2 = c0, hs1 = c2, hs0 = c3)
  df-mgm(hs2, hs1, hs0, s0, s1)
  diff.hs2.c(c0)
  diff.hs2.w(‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c2, ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà c2,(s0[c3]s1)‚àà c2)))
  diff.hs1.c((Base ` hs2))
  diff.hs1.w(hs2 = c0)
  diff.hs1.w(‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c2, ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà c2,(s0[c3]s1)‚àà c2)))
  diff.hs0.c((+ ` hs2))
  diff.hs0.w((hs2 = c0 ‚àß hs1 = c2))
  diff.hs0.w(‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c2, ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà c2,(s0[c3]s1)‚àà c2)))
  diff.wa.s(s0, (hs2 = c0 ‚àß hs1 = c2), hs0 = c3)
  diff.wa.s(s0, hs2 = c0, hs1 = c2)
  diff.wceq.s(s0, hs2, c0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs2)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs2)
  diff.wceq.s(s0, hs1, c2)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs1)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs1)
  diff.wceq.s(s0, hs0, c3)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.wa.s(s1, (hs2 = c0 ‚àß hs1 = c2), hs0 = c3)
  diff.wa.s(s1, hs2 = c0, hs1 = c2)
  diff.wceq.s(s1, hs2, c0)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs2)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs2)
  diff.wceq.s(s1, hs1, c2)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs1)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs1)
  diff.wceq.s(s1, hs0, c3)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs2.s(hs1)
  diff.hs1.s(hs0)
  diff.hs1.s(s0)
  diff.hs1.s(s1)
  diff.hs2.s(hs0)
  diff.hs2.s(s0)
  diff.hs2.s(s1)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
}

blocks.name: ismgmn0
blocks.content: The predicate "is a magma" for a structure with a nonempty base set. (Contributed by AV, 29-Jan-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm ismgmn0(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wb(wcel(c2, cmgm), wral(s0, c1, wral(s1, c1, wcel(co(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1)), c1)))))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(cbs, c2))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cplusg, c2))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
} = {
  syl(wcel(c0, c1), wb(wcel(c2, cmgm), wral(s0, c1, wral(s1, c1, wcel(co(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1)), c1)))), wcel(c2, universe))
  elfvexd(c2, c0, cbs, wcel(c0, c1))
  biimpi(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c0, cfv(cbs, c2)))
  eleq2i(c0, c1, cfv(cbs, c2))
  ismgm(s0, s1, c2, universe, c1, c3)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm ismgmn0(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  ‚ä¢ (c0 ‚àà c1 ‚Üí(c2 ‚àà Mgm ‚Üî ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c1, ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà c1,(s0[c3]s1)‚àà c1))))
  ‚ä£ c1 =(Base ` c2)
  ‚ä£ c3 =(+ ` c2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c3)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c1)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c3)
} = {
  syl(c0 ‚àà c1, (c2 ‚àà Mgm ‚Üî ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c1, ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà c1,(s0[c3]s1)‚àà c1))), c2 ‚àà ùïå)
  elfvexd(c2, c0, cbs, c0 ‚àà c1)
  biimpi(c0 ‚àà c1, c0 ‚àà(Base ` c2))
  eleq2i(c0, c1, (Base ` c2))
  ismgm(s0, s1, c2, universe, c1, c3)
}

blocks.name: mgmcl
blocks.content: Closure of the operation of a magma. (Contributed by FL, 14-Sep-2010.) (Revised by AV, 13-Jan-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm mgmcl(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cmgm), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wcel(co(c1, c4, c3), c2))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cbs, c0))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cplusg, c0))
} = {
  3impib(wcel(c0, cmgm), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2), wcel(co(c1, c4, c3), c2))
  syl(wcel(c0, cmgm), wi(wa(wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wcel(co(c1, c4, c3), c2)), wral(hs0, c2, wral(hs1, c2, wcel(co(cv(hs0), c4, cv(hs1)), c2))))
  ibi(wcel(c0, cmgm), wral(hs0, c2, wral(hs1, c2, wcel(co(cv(hs0), c4, cv(hs1)), c2))))
  ismgm(hs0, hs1, c0, cmgm, c2, c4)
  expcom(wral(hs0, c2, wral(hs1, c2, wcel(co(cv(hs0), c4, cv(hs1)), c2))), wa(wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wcel(co(c1, c4, c3), c2))
  ovrspc2v(hs0, hs1, c1, c2, c3, c2, c4, c2)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c4)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c2)
  diff.hs1.c(c4)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs1.c(c1)
  diff.hs1.c(c3)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm mgmcl(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  ‚ä¢ ((c0 ‚àà Mgm ‚àß c1 ‚àà c2 ‚àß c3 ‚àà c2)‚Üí(c1[c4]c3)‚àà c2)
  ‚ä£ c2 =(Base ` c0)
  ‚ä£ c4 =(+ ` c0)
} = {
  3impib(c0 ‚àà Mgm, c1 ‚àà c2, c3 ‚àà c2, (c1[c4]c3)‚àà c2)
  syl(c0 ‚àà Mgm, ((c1 ‚àà c2 ‚àß c3 ‚àà c2)‚Üí(c1[c4]c3)‚àà c2), ‚àÄ(hs0 ‚àà c2, ‚àÄ(hs1 ‚àà c2,(hs0[c4]hs1)‚àà c2)))
  ibi(c0 ‚àà Mgm, ‚àÄ(hs0 ‚àà c2, ‚àÄ(hs1 ‚àà c2,(hs0[c4]hs1)‚àà c2)))
  ismgm(hs0, hs1, c0, cmgm, c2, c4)
  expcom(‚àÄ(hs0 ‚àà c2, ‚àÄ(hs1 ‚àà c2,(hs0[c4]hs1)‚àà c2)), (c1 ‚àà c2 ‚àß c3 ‚àà c2), (c1[c4]c3)‚àà c2)
  ovrspc2v(hs0, hs1, c1, c2, c3, c2, c4, c2)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c4)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c2)
  diff.hs1.c(c4)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs1.c(c1)
  diff.hs1.c(c3)
}

blocks.name: plusffval
blocks.content: The group addition operation as a function. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 14-Aug-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm plusffval(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wceq(c0, cmpo(s0, s1, c1, c1, co(cv(s0), c2, cv(s1))))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(cbs, c3))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cplusg, c3))
  -| wceq(c0, cfv(cplusf, c3))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)

thm opifismgm(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0, wff w1) {

  -| diffsc(s0, c1)

  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
  -| diffsw(s1, w0)

  mpbird(w0, wcel(c0, cmgm), wral(hs0, c1, wral(hs1, c1, wcel(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cplusg, c0), cv(hs1)), c1))))

  adantr(w0, wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cv(hs1), c1)), wral(s0, c1, wral(s1, c1, wcel(cif(c2, c3, w1), c1))))
  ralrimivva(s0, s1, c1, c1, w0, wcel(cif(c2, c3, w1), c1))
  ifcld(c2, c3, c1, wa(w0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c1), wcel(cv(s1), c1))), w1)

  ismgmn0(hs0, hs1, cv(s0), c1, c0, cfv(cplusg, c0))

  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, cmgm)
  diff.cmgm.s(s0)
  diff.wral.s(s0, hs0, c1, wral(hs1, c1, wcel(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cplusg, c0), cv(hs1)), c1)))
